inclusion.label: met
inclusion.evidence: seizures at age 13, second seizure two years after first episode

inclusion.label: met
inclusion.evidence: maintained on Dilantin and phenobarbital, recently tapered off Dilantin

inclusion.criterion: Stable AED doses for at least 30 days
inclusion.label: unknown

inclusion.criterion: Vagal nerve stimulator treatment will be allowed
inclusion.label: met
inclusion.evidence: vagal nerve stimulator treatment will be allowed

inclusion.criterion: Seizures with or without secondary generalization
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: Partial simple seizures with a clear motor component with or without secondary generalization
inclusion.label: met
inclusion.evidence: facial twitching on the right and generalized shaking in at his NH

inclusion.criterion: Partial complex seizures including partial complex seizures with or without secondary generalization
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: Partial simple seizures with secondary generalization
inclusion.label: met
inclusion.evidence: seizures at age 13, second seizure two years after first episode

exclusion.criterion: Simple partial seizures without motor components or secondary generalization
exclusion.label: unknown

exclusion.criterion: Progressive neurological disease including neoplasm, CNS degenerative disorders
exclusion.label: not_met

exclusion.criterion: Any systemic illness or unstable medical condition that might pose additional risk
exclusion.label: unknown

exclusion.criterion: Change in the dose of any Antiepileptic Drug within 30 days prior to enrollment
exclusion.label: not_met

exclusion.criterion: Psychosis within six months of enrollment
exclusion.label: unknown

exclusion.criterion: Active drug or alcohol dependence or any other factors that, in the opinion of the site investigators would interfere with adherence to study requirements
exclusion.label: not_met

notes: 41 year old man with history of severe intellectual disability, CHF, epilepsy presenting with facial twitching on the right and generalized shaking in at his NH which required 20 mg valium to cease seizure activity. Per outside medical patient was felt to have focal epilepsy with secondary generalization, likely due to anoxic brain injury at birth, and probably related to the atrophic changes seen on MRI, particularly in the left temporal lobe.
